newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: IBCA affirms S.Africa Transnet's domestic ratings.
newsitem.headline: IBCA affirms S.Africa Transnet's domestic ratings.

text.p: Rating agency IBCA on Thursday reaffirmed South African transport utility Transnet Ltd's domestic short-term rating at A1-plus and long-term rating at AAA.
"An A-plus short-term rating indicates a particularly strong capacity for timely repayment," IBCA said in a statement.
It said a long-term rating of AAA indicated the lowest expectation of investment risk and a substantially strong capacity for timely repayment of principal and interest.
The funding of post-retirement liabilities remained a major problem to the group, with operating profit being diluted by the cost of servicing these liabilities, the rating agency said.
Increased provisions for pension and medical benefits had been the major factors depressing pre-interest profit, absorbing approximately 400 million rand per annum in the last four years.
The agency noted that Transnet's financial position should improve significantly once government's planned privatisation of state assets started in earnest.
